dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, you know, we always talk about Tesla dominating the EV space, but uh, GM just made some pretty *huge* announcements.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, you know, we always talk about Tesla dominating the E V space, but uh, G M just made some pretty huge announcements.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely! Mary Barra, I mean, she went on record at the Barclays conference, basically saying they're coming for Tesla. Like, *aggressively* coming for them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely! Mary Barra, I mean, she went on record at the Barclays conference, basically saying they're coming for Tesla. Like, aggressively coming for them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla wasnt mentioned in a presentation by CEO and Chairman Mary Barra to Barclays Global Automotive conference, but the Detroit-based companys aggressive strategic shift includes becoming the North American market share leader in the technology over the next few years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Aggressively" is an understatement! She, uh, said they're budgeting an *additional* five billion dollars between now and 2028. Totaling over twenty-five billion for EVs and autonomous vehicles.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: "Aggressively" is an understatement! She, uh, said they're budgeting an additional five billion dollars between now and twenty twenty eight. Totaling over twenty-five billion for E Vs and autonomous vehicles.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We will invest an additional $7 billion in EVs through 2025. bringing our total investment in EV and (autonomous vehicles) to over $27 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and their goal, right? To be the North American market share leader in EVs within the next two decades. That's a *big* claim for GM.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and their goal, right? To be the North American market share leader in E Vs within the next two decades. That's a big claim for G M.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the Detroit-based companys aggressive strategic shift includes becoming the North American market share leader in the technology over the next few years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It is! And, um, she didn't mince words. She literally said they're "committed to fighting for EV market share until we are number one in North America."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is! And, um, she didn't mince words. She literally said they're "committed to fighting for E V market share until we are number one in North America."
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Were committed to fighting for EV market share until we are number one in North America.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. I mean, they're planning 25 battery-powered models globally by 2030, with a third of those heading to North America. Think Cadillac, GMC, Chevy...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. I mean, they're planning twenty five battery-powered models globally by twenty thirty, with a third of those heading to North America. Think Cadillac, G M C, Chevy...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The biggest U.S. automaker plans to release 30 battery-powered models globally by 2025, two-thirds of which will be available to North American customers from its Cadillac, GMC, Chevrolet and Buick brands.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which, uh, you know, is interesting because GM was actually a pioneer with the EV1 way back when, and then they kind of just... stepped away.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, uh, you know, is interesting because G M was actually a pioneer with the E V one way back when, and then they kind of just... stepped away.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: GM was a pioneer in battery-powered cars, releasing the EV1 subcompact in California 24 years ago as an early test vehicle, its abandonment of the technology created an opportunity for Musk and Tesla in the early 2000s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally! They left the door wide open for Musk and Tesla in the early 2000s by focusing on, like, gas-guzzling trucks and SUVs. Now they're doing a total 180.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! They left the door wide open for Musk and Tesla in the early two thousand seconds by focusing on, like, gas-guzzling trucks and S U versus Now they're doing a total one hundred eighty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the past decade, the company has steadily grown its presence in the electric market, starting with Volt plug-in hybrid and Bolt EV, but kept its focus on money making carbon-fueled trucks and SUVs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, why now, do you think? I mean, besides, uh, Tesla's success.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, why now, do you think? I mean, besides, uh, Tesla's success.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, obviously lower battery costs are a factor, but also those tougher global CO2 rules, and let's not forget the incoming Biden administration prioritizing electric transportation. It's a perfect storm, really.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, obviously lower battery costs are a factor, but also those tougher global C O two rules, and let's not forget the incoming Biden administration prioritizing electric transportation. It's a perfect storm, really.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lower costs for batteries and components, tougher global rules to limit CO2 emissions and the incoming Biden Administration thats prioritizing electric transportation underpins the companys new strategy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And you see Tesla's market cap, like, three hundred billion dollars, S&P 500 jump... it feels like GM is playing catch-up, even if their production scale is way bigger.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And you see Tesla's market cap, like, three hundred billion dollars, S and P five hundred jump... it feels like G M is playing catch-up, even if their production scale is way bigger.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...have made it the worlds most valuable automaker with a market capitalization of $473 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: True, true. Tesla's production is still a fraction of GM's, but that's where their Ultium battery tech comes in. The Cadillac LYRIQ and Hummer EV will use it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, true. Tesla's production is still a fraction of G M's, but that's where their Ultium battery tech comes in. The Cadillac L Y R I Q and Hummer E V will use it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The first new model to get GMs lower-cost Ultium battery pack is the GMC Hummer EV due in late 2021 followed by the Cadillac LYRIQ crossover that arrives in early 2022. ... Teslas production capacity and earnings are a fraction of GMs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [mhm] And the initial Ultium versions, I read, might actually be, um, unprofitable? Like, 30% higher cost than their Bolt batteries?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the initial Ultium versions, I read, might actually be, um, unprofitable? Like, thirty percent higher cost than their Bolt batteries?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: GM says it will be able to sell electric vehicles with range of up to 400 miles per charge at a profit, owing to costs for its Ultium batteries that are about 40% below those currently used in its Bolt EV. ... GMs EV development times are speeding up and costs are going down rapidly, so we expect our Ultium EV programs to be profitable from the first generation on, Parks said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: For now, yeah. But they're saying the *next-gen* Ultium, coming in a few years, will be 50% cheaper and offer up to 400 miles of range. That's a game-changer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For now, yeah. But they're saying the next-gen Ultium, coming in a few years, will be fifty percent cheaper and offer up to four hundred miles of range. That's a game-changer.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A next-generation Ultium that arrives in a few years will be 60% cheaper than Bolt batteries and may offer a range of up to 450 miles per charge, said Doug Parks, GMs executive vice president for product development, purchasing and supply chain.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So they're playing the long game, essentially.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So they're playing the long game, essentially.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Plus, they're hiring 2,000 new tech workers just for this EV push. They're all-in.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Plus, they're hiring two thousand new tech workers just for this E V push. They're all-in.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier this month, GM said it would hire 3,000 new tech workers before the end of 2021s first quarter to help with the accelerated EV push.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It sounds like, uh, GM isn't just dipping their toes anymore. They're diving headfirst.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It sounds like, uh, G M isn't just dipping their toes anymore. They're diving headfirst.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. And it's going to be fascinating to watch this fight for market dominance unfold.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. And it's going to be fascinating to watch this fight for market dominance unfold.
